19958611.review:
[b]BEWARE OF HEAVY SPOILERS AHEAD![/b]

[h1]Storyline[/h1]:
The story was simply beautiful. The story continues directly after the first volume where the group is being confronted by Melano. The second volume shows the first part of the Viscanta arc where they met a tour guide named Sol, who is not what they think he is. Throughout the entire volume, there were two situations running along at the same time: [spoiler] The disappearance of Ritona and The struggles that Sol and his family is coping with survival [/spoiler]. Even though there were two issues happening concurrently, more empahasis was being placed onto the second one. 

Ritona and Princess Selphine have been given more character development in this volume, although they still have the habit emphasising more of it to the newly introduced characters in the volume. There are times where the story is paced very slowly but they were used to fully bring out the inner thoughts and feelings of every characters in the situation. There was a point where Sol was trying to learn how to control the environment to allow a medicinal plant to grow. At that point, his emotional struggles with life was slowly revealed and although I cannot understand the kind of feelings he had, but I still felt that it was well written to show that the start of something new is never easy.

Another major character development shown in the volume comes from Princess Selphine. Princess Selphine pretty much disappears in the second half of the volume and is replaced with the personality of her ancestor, Queen Rhegan. Initially, Queen Rhegan is shown to be a ruthless warmonger but after several interactions with Sol's sister, she easily became my favourite character in this volume. Not only did she turn out to be an extremely wise and charismatic person who could create inspirational quotes in two-thirds of the sentences she says, she also has a caring side as well.

The reason why I said that this story is beautiful is because once again, they hit really hard at the feels towards the end just like what they did for the first volume. [spoiler]Princess Selphine/Queen Rhegan knew the truth about Sol's family's circumstances but chose to bear the burden alone because she wanted Sol to direct his anger for greater good. The ending credits scene is also very touching as Mil eventually succumbs to her illness and passes away but Sol moves on to create his own farm and donated the produces to other residents.	[/spoiler]

One fault that I could possibly find in this story is the introduction of the trio who started their search for Ritona. While they desperately wants to track down Ritona and Princess Selphine and rescue them, I really doubt they would have any major plot significance in the series.

[h1] Graphics/Animation[/h1]

Fault Milestone 2 has really improved alot ever since the first volume. The artwork quality has improved and more animations have been added, What really impressed me the most was [spoiler] the entire game restarted once as a show of Melano's powers[/spoiler].I look forward to more hand drawn scenes because I feel that these scene were the most beautiful.

[h1] Conclusion[/h1]

Those who read Fault Milestone One must read this, they will blow your expectations away. Those who didn't can still take a look at the story but might struggle abit with unfamiliar terms. Don't make the mistake that I did of watching through youtube videos in the first volume, support the producers! I eagerly await for the third volume and the conclusion of the Viscanta arc. I also hope that they release a light novel adaptation and possibly an animation of this series.

По прежнему шикарно. Вторая часть хоть и вышла короче, получилась гораздо насыщеннее по событиям. Сюжет по прежнему великолепен и вышел даже интереснее чем в первой главе. Новых персонажей добавилось не много, а старые увы быстро уходят, но они прописаны очень хорошо. Порой конечно возникают странности, но на это не обращаешь абсолютно никаого внимания, настолько все приятно читается. Рисовка так же стала лучше. Плюс теперь сцены порой делают акцент на персонажах, что добавило динамичности. Единственное что печалит, это очередное "продолжение следует". Хочется чтобы история была цельной и законченной, но увы. И тем не менее, окончание у главы замечательное и не хочется сильно кричать от того что будет 3-я глава. Хочется просто дождаться и вновь вернуться к милым героиням, чтобы вновь узнать, что же ждет их дальше. Всем кому понравилась первая часть, брать немедленно. Если вы все еще думаете брать или нет, идите в магазин и купите обе главы, заварите чаю и заройтесь в шикарную историю путешествия трех девушек.

There is not much of a new characters, but they also very interesting. Sometimes, of course there are oddities, but you absolutely not want to pay any attention. Art just got better. Plus now the scene often focus on characters, which added to dynamism. The only thing that saddens, this is just another "to be continued". It would be desirable that the story was finished, but alas. Nevertheless, the end of the Milestone Two is wonderful and you will not want to scream about another "to be continued". Just want to wait and come back to the lovely heroine to re-learn what awaits them on. Everyone who liked the first part, to take immediately. If you still want to take it or not, go to the store and buy two chapters, make some tea and dive in gorgeous story of three girls.

Hey this is just another upvote for the game, okay? I am terrible at reviewing narratives (like VNs), so I'll just put this in perspective.

I've played a bunch of visual novels, ranging from Katawa Shoujo to Muv Luv (which I despised).  Honestly, fault is the only Visual Novel I've ever read that actually managed to be so good I wanted to throw all my money at it.  Pretty much everything else out there doesn't compare to fault.

Why?  Well, besides being very well written with lovable characters that succeed at breaking away from generic anime stereotypes, it also has something very dear to me that every narrative should have; a detailed, fascinating world.  Of course, it really helps that this world clicks with my interpretations and views of HOW FANTASTY SHOULD BE and such.  I guess this entire review is sort of pointless then, because of everything out there fault is one of the only things that actually managed to click with me.

So if you've heavy into detailed, intricate fantasy worlds with a spirit of adventure, a healthy dose of sci-fi, and covnersations about society and politics, fault is your cake.

If a stickler like me can love this, then there is no reason you shouldn't.

PS: Rhegan - Selly combo is the best.  PS:  this camera system is a legendary step forward in VN technology.

18872196.review:
I don't write reviews often. However in some cases where something exceptional is made i will.  Something that i can either put my time to for extremely long periods, enjoy it to a maximum extent where nothing gives me hesitation or where my very outlook on certain things change entirely. This visual novel bought out both 2 and 3 of these 3 reasons.

The art/style: The visuals are absolutly stunning, amazing barely covers it. I presonally love it and feel that it adds a lot to the visual novel with the different backgrounds, charater designs, and effects. The intro and credits are the only two "movie" cg throughout the game but are well done for how short they are both explaining the latest events from fault milestone 1 and the aftermath of whats happened in this visual novel. The CG itself is beautiful and again really shows off the skill and talent  at  Alive in Dissonance. This game is visually stunning in every detail

The story: (No spoilers) The story took me about 4-5 hours to complete. This is fairly short but don't go into it expecting to read little. In the time given the story explodes with absolute moments of intensity, moments of calm (including in the menu screen) moments of disbelief and one moment of genuine anger towards a charcter. It was filled wit a lot of emotions. Also desipte its size this visual novel can be both for casual readers and those are looking for something that truly surfices their reading needs. I will say this as well. The way the story moves forward is smooth. There are no points i felt it was rushed or needed to be sped up. Unlike the fault milestone 1 i felt i could have read this visual novel the whole way through in one sitting with no problems at all (not to say fault milestone 1 was bad because it isn't). 

The characters: There are 3 main characters, multiple sub characters and the main bad group of enemies. The 3 main characters develop an ever bigger sense of self showing their personalities even more so then they already had been. Providing a new outlook on them especially with Rune and Selphine. Sadly with Ritona although we don't see much change in personality or even development in her overall character. We do get a new side of her compared to Fault Milestone 1 that is caused mainly by the events of Fault Milestone 1 as well as an event that occurs within Fault Milestone 2.

The new characters you meet as well as old characters from Fault Milestone 1 were somehow all unique and none felt they were wasted or pointless at all. One thing that was interesting is the fact that even characters who had little to no input into the story still had actual character models made for them. Hell a few characters you never even found out their name.  I'm espeically interested in what will happen with Flora, Misha and Riggs.

Next the group of "enemies" now due to my no spoiler review this will be harder to explain. We see barely anything about them again in 2 however we do get a little bit of interest from the leader. Learning her power and even her breaking the 4th wall very slightly. It gave a whole insight into what Ritona and Selphine are up against when returning home to Rughzenhide. 

Replayability: Although i find it hard to replay most visual novels without having a very large gap inbetween play times. I can very easily see myself replaying this. It left me wanting, no craving for Fault Milestone 2 : below. I really cannot wait to see how the story progresses.

Music: The soundtrack and effects made are truly incredible. They push forth what the scene is trying to make you feel. Anger, Sadness, Intensity. The general mood in visual novels hinges by a pivot and the music really sets the mood into what the writers clearly wanted the mood to feel like for the reader. The soundtrack is great but doens't have anything in my mind that stood out such as The fruit of grisaia's Home (for Amane) or Holograph (for Sakaki) in Their respective routes.

Overall: I really really enjoyed this visual novel. No ifs or buts about it. It was a massive improvement on what was already a good 1st game. Although we are left with a lot of unanwsered questions I got a brilliant amount of satisfaction from the game. I would highly recommend trying it. 

However  for the love of god play through the 1st fault milestone. If you do not you may be very confused as to what is going on.

Final score 10/10 At the least a must try. After reading through this visual novel i'd be happy paying for it at full price despite how short it may seem.

18528543.review:
[h1][i][b]Еду в [strike]Магадан[/strike] Ругзенхайд...[/b][/i][/h1]

Сегодня мы взглянем на первую часть второго эпизода (мы разделили часть на части, чтобы ты мог ждать следующую часть, пока ждёшь следующую часть) приключений Сельфины, Ритоны и Рун от ALICE IN DISSONANCE и Sekai Project под названием fault milestone two side:above. Продолжим же! (Мой обзор на первый эпизод можно найти [url=http://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198023062944/recommended/286260/]здесь[/url].)

[u]Сюжет.[/u]
Сюжет здесь очень захватывающий. Приятно видеть, что после успеха первой части, разрабы не сбавляют обороты.
Нетрудно догадаться, что началом этой части является конец [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/286260]предыдущей[/url] ([b][u]крайне[/u][/b] рекомендуется к прочтению перед началом прохождения этой части, а то вообще нихрена не поймёте, ибо игра начинается [b]безо всякого предисловия[/b]). Принцесса Сельфина, её телохранитель Ритона и их подруга Рун отправляются домой в Ругзенхайд, но встречают своего заклятого врага, Мелано. К счастью, [strike]им удаётся отбиться от неё[/strike] она оставляет их в покое, и троица продолжает своё путешествие. И да, это снова история в истории (ни капли не минус, вот серьёзно). В порту, куда они прибывают, их встречает мальчик по имени Сол, и предлагает им показать город. Они соглашаются. Поначалу всё идёт спокойно, [i]но не тут-то было...[/i] Да, там есть НЕОЖИДАННЫЙ ПОВОРОТ, после которого надежда компании на быстрое прибытие домой рушится. Не буду рассказывать дальше, а то [b]СПОЙЛЕРЫ!!![/b]
По длине сюжет в этой части вышел примерно таким же, как и в предыдущей: 8 часов.

[u]Геймплей.[/u]
Ну, кинетическая новелла, всё стандартно, никаких выборов.

[u]Графен.[/u]
Как и в прошлой части, графика действительно хороша. Рисовка осталась прежней: порой кажется, что всё нарисовано самой настоящей краской прямо на экране. Новых спрайтов для героев и героинь из предыдущей части не завезли, но это и не особо нужно. А какие здесь CG-арты...
Тем не менее, в [i]некоторых[/i] местах при [i]сильном[/i] приближении (здесь добавили какую-никакую анимацию, хоть это всего лишь приближение/удаление/движение камеры между персонажами) становятся видны лесенки из пикселей (да, мамкины Ваномасы, можете начинать орать, что "текстурки-то 98 год"). Но глаз особо не режет.

[u]Звук.[/u]
Озвучки персонажей нет, но мы все уже привыкли, ведь так?
А вот за саундтрек разрабам отдельное спасибо. Все композиции - просто шедевры,

[u]От себя.[/u]
Душевно, очень душевно. Трогает. Как хороший фильм/сериал: не знаешь, чего хочешь больше - поскорее узнать, что будет дальше, или растянуть удовольствие.
Юморец присутствует, и его в самый раз. Не заставляет скучать, пока сюжет не зацепит, но и не перебивает впечатление от него.
Ах да, ещё порадовал один момент... Не буду говорить, в чём суть. Скажу одно: я офигел. Очень внезапно и очень круто. К счастью, он в начале игры, так что ваше ожидание будет недолгим.
А, ну ещё английский надо знать нормально. А то каждую реплику в онлайн-переводчик вбивать не дело.
Ставлю всю серию на одну виртуальную полку с [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/315810]eden*[/url].
С нетерпением жду следующую часть.

10 пойманных стрел из 10.
К покупке [b]чертовски[/b] рекомендуется.

[url=http://www.the-backlog.net/fault-milestone-two-side-above-review/]My full review can be found here.[/url]

Disclaimer: I was provided a copy by the publisher for review.

In fault milestone two side:above, you follow the story of Selphine, Ritona, and Rune as they try to travel back home from the Outer Pole. They run into some difficulties, and end up with this full part revolving around their time Port/Neo Sasary. While the start and end felt quite well paced, it did feel like a massive drag in every other part.

The game does have some minor issues. Namely, some lines near the start will randomly repeat, often with a different "speaker" for them. There are also spelling errors every now and then, and on at least one occasion the entirely wrong speaker is said for a line (that wasn't a repeat). Despite that, fault milestone two side:above has a fantastic story - although I felt it had some lacking pacing issues at times - along with amazing graphics and music.

I do highly suggest reading/playing fault milestone one beforehand though, although it is possible to get through two side:above without having done so. After all, that's what I ended up doing. There'll be some bits you still end up confused on, even with the "previously on fault" and encyclopedia available, but the story is still gripping enough.

18344718.review:
A marked improvement over (the already very good!) fault Milestone One in every single way!

The visuals in particular stand head and shoulders over just about any VN I've read. The CG and character art is at least as good as the first but there is now roughly twice as many CG images as Milestone One despite this installment being slightly shorter than the first (more on that further down). 

But, even more than that, the clever '3D Camera' system that has been added extracts so much more from each image by the clever way it pans and zooms around the images during dialogue and action-y sequences (rather a lot of those this time!). Coupled with the typical changes in expression of the characters and other subtle changes it created a great sense of movement and pace without actual animation. You'll understand what I mean when you see it in action!

The story and dialogue itself as excellent and they have definitely addressed one of the key criticisms of Milestone One with it's unnecesery.. wordiness in a small number of scenes. Things feel a lot more punchy and to the point this time; the plot itself is generally a lot more fast paced in this installment so it suits it well. 

This time Selphine and Rune take center stage and Ritona sits out much of the story for plot reasons. I feel there's some great development in Rune's character as she becomes more sure of herself culminating in one seriously epic scene that I won't spoil here. :) And you'll certainly see a very different, ah, "side" of Selphine throughout the story too...

However, Rhegan has to be my favourite character of this part. It's easy to dismiss her as just a *censored* when she first appears, but I guarentee she will grow on you as you come to understand her throughout the story; I came to respect her a great deal if not necessrily 'like' her. Her ruthlessness is certainly no facade but she has damned good reasons for being as such; that and her sharp cunning serves the girls well.


As negatives.. well the character art of the side characters is of markedly lower quality than that of the main characters. Understandable, sure, but when the quality of everything else is so excellent in contrast you can't help but notice. 

Also this is only the first half of Milestone Two due to a decision to split it into two releases. As such there are rather a number of plot threads that are raised but left unresolved. Though the central plot 'side:above' centers around is concluded and it doesn't exactly end on a cliffhanger like Milestone One did it's a little frustrating knowing I'll be waiting rather a while to see certain events resolved.


Alice in Dissonance is onto something very, *very*, special with the fault series and I hope it gets the recognition it deserves so they can keep it going for a long time to come!

18273072.review:
The first 'fault' is amazing.

The second is that, and much more. ALICE IN DISSONANCE shows that they're serious in really pushing the bar on what the Visual Novel medium can pull off, though I can't really explain in detail without spoiling some cool stuff that happens in the story.

Everything has been improved over the first; scenes and backgrounds are high quality, the music and ambience never fail to set the appropriate mood for each scene, and their use of their newly implemented "3D camera" really does make the whole experience that much better.

And following up on what I mentioned in my review for 'fault milestone one', 'milestone two' takes the foundation that was set before and builds well on top of it, delving deeper into the origins of manakravte and other "intangible" concepts that were introduced prior. Seeing as there's rarely actually a need to explain the mechanics of "magic' and the like in stories of fantasy, the extra lore is a really nice touch, and makes the tale a whole lot juicier.

If you've read the first, get it. Once again, you won't regret it!

18194637.review:
My review of Fault Milestone One wasn’t particularly positive, and neither will this be. But having said that, Milestone Two is better than I dared hope. It takes big steps forward in quality from the first one, and though I still can’t recommend it, it shows the creators learning and improving rapidly.

My problems with Fault Milestone Two start with the opening. It doesn’t smoothly draw you into the story of the lives of the characters, instead it slams you right into an action scene without knowing what’s going on. There’s just too much information too fast, without giving you time to latch on to something human to care about. They kind of wrote themselves into this corner by ending Fault Milestone One with the start of this scene. The sequence is creative and impressive in its production quality. But I wish they’d rolled back the story, to give us some time to get reacquainted with the cast, and to know where they’re going. All it needed was a couple minutes of calm before the storm. Because as it is now, when the opening scene ends, the air goes out of the story. It takes a good while before it builds up momentum and feel like it’s going somewhere.

The marketing describes Fault Milestone Two as a “cinematic” visual novel, and it lives up to that moniker, both in good ways and bad. The positive is that the developers went to town with production values. Part one already looked good, but this takes it to another level, using multiple angles and simple animations during key scenes. The audio is also way above average for a visual novel, with both music and ambient sound doing a lot to heighten the sense of presence and mood.

I’m not sure if it was an intentional stylistic choice in order to make it feel more “cinematic”, but the writing feels distant from the characters. You rarely get any insight into what the viewpoint character is thinking or feeling inside. For much of the episode the primary viewpoint character is Ritona, the personal guard of a princess, who are on the run after enemies conquered their country. The viewpoint is so distant I often forgot that she, and not the camera, was the viewpoint. This harms some scenes quite bad.

For example, at one point the cast arrives at the port of a new city and are approached by a boy claiming to be a tour guide. His appearance doesn’t suggest he is anything other than what he claims to be. Ritona is suspicious of the boy, but because the scene is told entirely though dialog, she comes across as hysterically irrational. I wish Fault would make more use of the fact that it’s told through text. The dialog writing and portraits aren’t good enough to make up for it. Something made her suspicious, but without getting even a little hint of what it was, she just acts rude for no apparent reason. Movies have a hell of a time trying to convey people’s inner thoughts visually, while novels can easily move inside a character’s head and show us what’s going on in there. Fault Milestone Two does that a few times, so it isn’t averse to doing it. I wish it’d do it more often so I wouldn’t sit there trying to figure out whether a character is a racist, hates children, or if I’m an idiot who missed something.

Another problem I had is that it suffers from “RPG side quest syndrome”. I.e., it feels like the characters should be doing more important things than what they’re doing. There are multiple story threads, and they aren’t balanced as well as they could. One of them is underlined clearly as “the main story”, “urgent”, and “seriously, this is important” for the characters. And instead of relentlessly pursuing that threat, they go off and do something else. I wish they’d deemphasize the story threads that won’t be resolved within the episode you’re in, and just keep them simmering in the background for later.  

It’s well worth playing this in fullscreen, as the default window doesn’t convey how high rez the artwork actually is. The passion that went into it is clearly visible. Almost every minor character gets their own sprite, and there’s tons of backgrounds and alternative angles to break up the traditional visual novel aesthetic. It’s a big story, with many moving parts, some marching forward to some goal we’ll only see in future installments. I’m interested in seeing what happens next, but I’m a bit worried about where it will end up. There’s so much going on already, that I hope future installments calm down a bit and don’t introduce anything new, for at least one episode. As it is now, the pace is glacial.

Fault Milestone Two is close to ok, but not quite there. I noticed myself skimming past the many lore exposition scenes, and some of the dialog is diabolically bad. Parts of the story hit like they should, and I certainly enjoyed the lavish production values. But it still feels like it’s written by amateurs, who don't inspire enough confidence that they know what they're doing. But at the rate they're improving, they might get it right next time, or the time after that. We'll see.

18167308.review:
fault milestone two side: above returns with another story, directly following the events of milestone one, and like the first episode, it eschews the adventure fare for a more human story, which it pulls off nicely, though it keeps feeding us hints of the overall big picture journey.

This time around, there were less 'fantastic' elements, in that the magic presented corresponded more closely to conveniences we have with present-day technology (such as long-range communications, without spoiling anything specifically). And per its pedigree, rather than dwelling too much on the details of such magic itself, the story uses them to explore what people would do with such tools at their disposal, and the effects on both personal relationships and society in general, making a few not-so-subtle parallels to things people do in the present-day.

The presentation continues to be well done, including the music which was appropriate and enjoyable, and the artwork which felt quite improved over the first installment. The backgrounds for different locales seemed more diverse this time around as well. And though the basic themes of the story are ones that have been retold many times before in other places, a solid execution of the storytelling counts for much in my estimation, without necessarily having to create anything unique or complex (after all, what story *hasn't* been told over the last few thousand years of human history anyhow?), and fault delivers in this respect.

I found side:above's story to be less elaborate than milestone one's, which started playing out a number of different threads, giving hints of how they are weaved together here and there, and then finally completing and showing off the pattern at the end when all the pieces of the puzzle fall into place in an emotional crescendo. The sequel is a bit of a different style, more straightforward, with less mystery but more emotion sprinkled throughout, though certain threads are left hanging at the very end. This chapter is half a chapter it seems (with side:below to be forthcoming), and is thus unfortunately even shorter than the first episode.

So as with my review of milestone one, I continue to wait with anticipation for the next installment...

18066107.review:
With this installment Fault Milestone becomes arguably the best Visual Novel series on Steam. Not only that but Alice in Dissonance could even be compared to the VN kings Nitro+ and MAGES. in terms of overall quality. Keep up the fantastic work Alice. From the opening minutes to the closing credits this VN is an incredibly well written, well directed, and well paced journey all the way through.

Picking up at the exact moment the original left off you're greeted with surprise after surprise on the journey along with mystery, suspense, lots of feels, and wonderful wonderful character development. Even the end credits are wonderfully done and will leave a lasting impression. The rise in production quality from the first is immediately apparent even in the first few lines of the VN, and that is saying something considering the level of polish the first one had. Although this installment also follows the same anime-ey/manga-ey (it was supposed to be a manga originally) "come to a new place, meet new people, move on" story arc style (similar to One Piece for a popular example) the characters and pacing are leagues ahead of anything similar I've seen especially considering this is from an indie studio.

Also much like the first the overall plot regarding the journey home gets touched mostly at the start, and any scenes regarding the overarching story after are sprinkled throughout allowing the urgency of the situation to still be clear even as the VN is in the middle of the story arc for the new location. Those who have played the first will also be pleased to know that the great art from the first has somehow improved along with a lot more backgrounds and transitional effects that really make this VN stand out from many others I've played. The OST for this game is also one of the best I've heard in a VN, and thankfully the opening movie is slower than the first which moved so fast it was fairly difficult to read it all.

The only cons I can think of are:
-This game is too great not to get Voice Acting, but the lack of any voice actors allow for the higher quality of everything else. I can only hope that they will one day be able to patch some Voices in.
-Some of the art for the one-off characters is of noticeably lower quality than of everything else. While this isn't exactly a problem the level of polish this VN has definitely makes the disparity in quality stand out more.

Overall:
9.5/10
I can only hope the rest of the series continues to be as great as this release was.

18023778.review:
This game is a really great VN. The story flows and the characters are just as engaging as they were in the first one. The graphics are some of the most beautiful I have ever seen in a game and the soundrack is equally amazing. My computer is a little old so some of the CG scenes lagged for me but I am sure that on a better computer they will run just fine. It is really important that you play the first Fault Milestone before you play this one because the story won't make as much sense to you if you just start with this one(the first game is a little slow and expostion heavy but develops a really compelling world and characters over time with a story that will grip you and leave you wanting more by the end of it.). The real plus to this game though is the character development; they are not just the awesome protagonists that we grew to love in the first game but they start to grow in such a way that will make you root for them even more than you had before (Selphine and Rune's relationship in particular is a highlight).

As for the negavtives there are a couple. The first being a few side characters that had a little more screen time than I personally cared for. In my review of the demo I mentioned Flora, Misha and Riggs and how their story kind of bored me a few times but I gave it a pass assuming their arc would develop into something really interesting but by the time I finished the game I was a little dissapointed. Their story did not really go anywhere and felt like wasted time. I know there is a sequel already in the works and that they will probably somehow play into the main plotline but honestly their side story felt like kind of a drag to get through (especially since I had to watch it twice because for some reason I wasn't allowed to skip past the parts I had seen in the demo). 

The other major gripe I had is connected with my previous point in that the story in this one kind of felt like filler for things to come. I do not want to spoil anything but the first couple hours of the game was wonderful in how it set everything up and immediately pulled you in. The game unfortunately does not really capitalize on that too much and there are a lot of loose ends left by the time the game ends. I was legitmately surprised when the game ended and not because it had a great cliffhanger (it doesn't) but because it felt a little incomplete (I actually said out loud "Wait...that's it?").  For a little background; Fault Milestone 2 has been split into two games "Fault Milestone Two: Above" and "Fault Milestone Two: Below" and it definetely shows. I'm sure there is a perfectly good reason for splitting the game but after finishing Above it feels very much like an incomplete game which is a little dissappointing.

Despite my gripes this game is still worth your time; especially if you enjoyed the first game. It, for the most part imporves on the first one and despite my personal problems with the story "Fault Milestone Two: Above" has a great story that will make you impatient to discover how everything pans out for Selphine, Ritona and Rune.

fault milestone 2: side above is half of a two part segment of fault milestone 2.  The story includes deep emotional and philisophical themes, and it is neither kid friendly, nor overly violent.  Characters act in realistic ways, and sometimes simple characters act in frustratingly simple ways.  This, however, showcases the masterpiece of writing and directing on the author's part, and showcases the difference in complexity between our main heroes and the side characters.

You will read about disparity between rich and poor, discrimination, and even struggles of self-acceptance.  The action scenes are top notch and the use of the 3d camera plugin for Renpy is superb.

Pros:

* Deep philisophical themes
* action packed
* intriguing world
* realistic characters
* doesn't submerse itself in overused anime tropes
* the feels

Cons:

18011324.review:
Would definitely recommend this to anyone that played and liked milestone one, and would recommend the game series to anyone that likes adventure and/or character driven visual novels.

As a sequel to milestone one, this brings a few new features that are small but well appreciated improvements to its entertainment value. The scene transitions and "zooming" in on characters during points of interest really help flesh out those serious scenes. And the couple of new facial expressions for our main cast are hilarious.

The background art has major improvements, as the setting for this game allows for much more beautiful scenes than in the prequel. Having many more backgrounds and CGs also ups the visual variety and game immersion.

I heard the devs were going to make their own soundtrack for this game (as the prequel used songs from elsewhere), but haven't made sure of this. Either way, the music is pretty solid and there are some memorable tracks for me.

And of course the same pretty solid story that I've come to expect from this  series.

18008003.review:
What a great read.

If you haven't already please read Fault Milestone One as this game picks up right where the first one left off. There's a pros and cons list for a condensed review below.

Without spoiling too much, the story in milestone 2 focuses mainly on some important humane issues/morals  like discrimination, greed, and poverty. The story gives us more insight into Selphine as a character as well as fleshing out Rune's personality and her interactions with Selphine. Also, new characters are introduced that give more backstory for Ritona and Selphine. 

The story has great background music that perfectly matches with different scenes ranging from jarring violin screeches to warming piano notes. The art is as beautiful as ever just like the first game and the icing on the cake is the flashy and dynamic movements of the character portraits across the screen which adds great immersion as a reader. 

Another great read and I highly recommend this visual novel!

Pros:
+ Artwork is beautiful
+ Sound that immerses the reader 
+ Dynamic character movements effectively bring the scenes to life
+ Increased character development for Rune and Selphine
+ Real-life issues are addressed like greed, poverty, and discrimination

Cons:
- No voice acting (for me it adds more depth to the characters)
- Short! (but this sort of depends on your reading speed)
- Later into the story it doesn't mention the new characters brought up earlier in the game
- Cliffhanger... again ):

17998708.review:
For you that just want a quick review, i say this as simple as possible. This kinetic novel story, is the best that i have ever read. The character development, the plot, the art, the music, its all done professionally and beautifully craft. You should buy and read the first one and also buy and read the second one. Now, if you still need more reason, Let me tell you in this long wall of text.

First thing first, the character development is.. wow. Its very good, you will know, care, and feel connected with the characters after you done with this kinetic novel. Usually in a lot of anime or visual novel, the way they tell the ruthless character to soften up is to change their personality instanly once they soften up, but this kinetic novel managed to make the ruthless character stay ruthless, but giving her a deep and logical reason of why she is ruthless. There is no one dimensional characters in this kinetic novel. It managed to makes me care with every characters even the evil one, and also makes me curious about others characters that the kinetic novel still didn't tells. Every characters have a reason to do what they do, even though it feels wrong at first, that is the best part of the characters.

The plot is well done as well, because it depends on the characters and as i said above, the characters development is really good. Although the plot didn't have the "Unique" stuff like the first one have, it is still engaging and also fun while also very touching and might makes you cry. I have to say this however, this one is also leaving a lot of unanswered plot point while didn't really answered the first one. Unlike the first one however, the plot give the main character a better reason of why they do what they do, why they help the people along the way even though their freaking kingdom is in danger !

The art and the visual as you see on the store page is very nice and beautifully drawn, it what makes me even try this title when it first came out. Like i said on my fault milestone 2 demo review, they have a freaking battle cutscene !! In a kinetic novel !!! All the battle CG feels alive and engagging which is really good, not a lot of visual novel could do that to me, to make my imagination fill in the blank. In my mind, the battle CG plays out like an anime instead of still pictures.

I don't know how to comment about the music, but i know when a background music is good and did their job well, and this novel background music did that both. they help me connect to a scene, like a sad scene or a fight scene. One of my dissapointment however, its the lack of voice acting. A lot of jokes felt flat because of it, because i know i would have laugh out loud if i heard the intonation of the characters when they said this funny stuff.

Soo, yeah ! Recommended to the highest degree. If you enjoy visual novel and reading, be sure to buy this. If you enjoy an epic and touching story, be sure to buy this. Just buy this already ! Steamkravter, buy this ! ^-^

・・・が、やっぱり続きが非常に気になる終わり方なので、早く下篇も作ってください（渇望）

以下、ネタバレになりそうなとこは一応ステルスにしてます。

前作冒頭にて祖国を追われ、世界の裏側まで飛ばされてしまったお姫様とそのボディガード。
紆余曲折あったものの旅の仲間も増え、ようやくマナの豊かな地・インナーポールへと帰還した一行だが、
立ち寄った港町にて再び大きな騒動に巻き込まれていく・・・というストーリー。
今作からは同時進行で、祖国に残された者達の動向も描かれるようになった。

相変わらず世界観の練り込みがすさまじく、
マナクラフト（魔法）の設定についてもさらに深く掘り下げられ、世界の国々がどういう情勢になっているか等も語られる。
ついでにルーンちゃんの数々のビックリ能力も明らかに。
ってかルーンちゃんすごすぎるでしょう・・・もうこの娘だけいればいいんじゃないかな
[spoiler]秒間20000コマの動きが見えるってもはや何が何だかわからないレベル[/spoiler]

ちなみに今作は訳あってセルフィーネ姫とリトナさんの出番が非常に少ないです。好きな人は次作に期待しましょう・・・
[spoiler]でも正直私はリガン様のキャラの方が好きです[/spoiler]
今回のメインとなる兄妹の話は、涙腺崩壊必至。
[spoiler]ただあの腐れ薬剤師のせいで後味は悪い。妹ちゃん何とかして助けられなかったのか・・・
クリア後のタイトル画面で少しは救われた感はあるけど[/spoiler]

前作のレビューにも書いたけど、ファンタジーモノが好きな人になら間違いなくオススメできる作品。
ただ完結していないので、続きが気になっちゃって仕方がないような人は完結してからまとめてやった方がいいかも？
かなり風呂敷を広げてるので完結が何年後になるか、
そもそもちゃんと完結するのかもわからないけど・・・

Very stylish VN, but I'd say that milestone one was better-written overall. Looking forward to what ms2b brings.

17994713.review:
Lange, zu lange musste ich auf den zweiten Teil von fault warten. Aber eins kann ich hier schon einmal vorweg nehmen: Das warten auf fault milestone two side:above hat sich gelohnt. Ich wurde hier definitiv nicht enttäuscht und auch wenn es wieder relativ kurz ist, war die Visual Novel jede Minute lesen vollkommen wert.

[quote]Entwickler: Alice in Dissonance
Genre: Fantasy
Länge: 2-10h
Premiere: 08.09.2015

Story:
Fault Milestone Two is a Cinematic Visual Novel that takes place right after the events of fault milestone one. With the addition of a new 3D camera system, fault milestone two aims to introduce a more immersive and „larger than life“ reading experience. Follow the grand science fantasy story of Selphine and the gang as they traverse back to their homeland![/quote]

[h1]Handlung:[/h1]

fault milestone two ist in zwei Teile gesplitet. Zum einen site:above und zum anderen site:below. Wie diese Aufteilung zu Stande kommt erfährt man hier im Verlauf der Novel. Gefühlt gibt es nun im Sequel auch ein bisschen mehr Action. Dadurch kommt aber auch hier das Drama und die Handlung keinesfalls zu kurz. Vor allem der Anfang der Novel startet mit einem richtigen Bang und zieht einen direkt wieder in die Welt von fault hinein. Auch wenn ein paar Tage mehr zwischen jetzt und dem ersten Teil vergangen sind, wird man so direkt wieder in die Geschichte hinein gezogen.

Was die Handlung selbst betrifft, so hat mir diese sogar noch besser gefallen als der erste Teil. Dies liegt nicht zuletzt an den Veränderungen, die Selphine durch macht und das Rune nun ein richtig aktives Mitglied der Gruppe ist. Dafür bekommt Ritona hier weniger Screentime. Dies sollte sich aber mit dem (hoffentlich bald) kommenden site:below ändern.

[h1]Illustrationen:[/h1]

Bei den Illustrationen hat sich im Gegensatz zum ersten Teil auch was getan. Die Hintergründe sind mit mehr Details versehen und auch das Charakterdesign hat sich noch ein bisschen verbessert. Für die doch relativ geringe Dauer von fault gibt es eine Vielzahl von CGs. In dieser Hinsicht gab es zum eh schon guten ersten Teil noch einmal eine Verbesserung.

[h1]Charaktere:[/h1]

Neben Rune und Selphine, die in diesem Teil die Hauptrollen übernehmen, gibt es natürlich auch wieder Ritona, sowie ein paar neue Nebencharaktere. Das neue Design von Selphine und das Prinzip des Path-Down haben mir sehr gut gefallen. Dies bringt noch zusätzlich Würze hinein. Die neuen Nebencharaktere, Sol und Mil haben mir gut gefallen. Sie bringen einen Teil des Dramas in die Geschichte, wirken dabei aber nicht zu berechenbar oder aufdringlich. Rupika, von dem Charakter weiß ich noch nicht was ich halten soll. Auf jeden Fall ist er schön zwielichtig und passt in die Story.

[h1]Sound:[/h1]

Während für den ersten Teil die Musik eingekauft war, wurde dieses Mal die Musik für die Visual Novel selbst produziert. Dies hat fault milestone two aber definitiv nicht geschadet. Die Musik ist wieder sehr harmonisch und auf die Szenen abgestimmt und meiner Meinung nach nun auch deutlich abgestimmter. Die einzelnen Songs passen gut zusammen und auch der wechsel Zwischen verschiedenen Songs ist gut gelungen

[h1]Fazit:[/h1]

Es hat zu lange gedauert bis diese Fortsetzung erschienen ist und als es dann endlich da war, war es ein viel zu kurzes Vergnügen. Alles in allem hat mir fault milestone two side:above noch besser gefallen als der erste Teil. Ich kann die Visual Novel wirklich nur jedem empfehlen, der bereits den ersten Teil gelesen hat.

[h1]9/10[/h1]

17983163.review:
前作商店链接: http://store.steampowered.com/app/286260
正如商店页面所写的,非常建议先玩前作,否则世界观可能会让你很头疼.
比起前作在CG,音乐,表现力等方面前进了一大步,玩过前作的应该能轻松感觉到这些进步,不管怎么说我的钱没白花(笑
还是先说几个缺点
整个流程其实比起前作要短一些(也有千分之一的可能是因为本人的英文水平进步导致阅读变快了)
然后文字在逐渐显示的过程中会有稍微一点点缺失,全部显示之后恢复正常,不影响阅读但是看着不怎么舒服.
前两章有大概三五句台词重复出现了,像是bug.(现应该已修复.)
关于这两个问题本人等处理完手头的事情会在最近私下联系开发人员确认一下是不是bug,总之不是什么影响理解的问题.
关于本作的剧情,就稍微在不剧透的情况下说点个人看法,你要是喜欢前作的剧情本作的剧情肯定也会对你胃口所以不用有什么担心.
然后提一下Cinematic Novel的事情,Alice in Dissonance希望利用Renpy引擎的性能向fault系列引入一些在传统VN中难以实现的表现方式,所以你在本作中可以看到一些也许是其他VN中没有使用过的表现手法(玩的少所以不能那么确定).
主要的感受是大量运用了动态的镜头,配合整个剧情的节奏还是感觉很不错的.
关于Cinematic Novel的详细可以在AiD的Patreon页面: https://www.patreon.com/fault?ty=h 查看,还有一段来自油管的演示视频,感兴趣的也可以先看一下.
想要支持开发者的话也可以用Patreon.
啊,还是没有语音,似乎有很多人比较在意这方面.
关于CG和立绘,细节上的进步还是很大的,不过画风没什么变化所以要是因为画风原因放弃这个系列的话我也只能表示遗憾了.
音乐总体个人感觉比前作更加柔和一些吧,不知道这么讲是不是合适,本人也想不出更好的说法了.
总之,我非常喜欢这一作,也非常喜欢前作,如果你愿意多了解一下这个系列,能够喜欢上这个系列的话,我就算没有白写这么多了.
-------------------------------------------------------
2016年5月26日更新
Patreon改版也有段时间了,页面上概述性的信息应该是基本没有了.
不过AiD官网比起一开始好了不少,有想了解的可以先去官网看看.
-------------------------------------------------------
2016年9月3日更新
Patreon叕改版了,总之现在上面能看到些简介.
https://www.patreon.com/fault

17979249.review:
Milestone two is more of milestone one. Which isn't necessarily terrible - the art, soundtrack, UI and characters remain consistently amazing. 
An issue with this chapter was the introduction of and subsequent lack of development of characters on the other side of the world from the protagonists - they get about 15 minutes of story in the first half and you never hear from them again.
Another is the 'buy the third chapter to find out what happens next!!!!'-tier ending. No spoilers here, but it's extremely cliffhangery, much like the first.
It should be noted that I read pretty quick, and you're paying $15 for not a lot of content, so even after finishing the game I'm actually still eligible for a refund. You could probably do the same, I'm only keeping it in my library out of a fondness for the story so far. (Also I'm totally going to idle the shit out of it for a crack at those 20+ foil cards, oh baby.)

If you haven't read milestone one, don't bother.
If you thought milestone one was worth $15, you should probably get this too.
If you thought milestone one wasn't anything great but this is on sale you should also probably click buy.

If you skipped the rest of the review there's yuri subtexts, multiple strong contenders for best girl and Ritona sideboob event CG. 10/10 VN of the year.

17974473.review:
先說結論：AMAZING！

-----
先說我覺得甚為可惜但瑕不掩瑜的一個小缺點：劇情的分割上斷得太突然。
主線劇情（不知名耍帥大叔 & 怎麼回主城）與支線劇情（帶路小鬼）並行下
本續作《side:above》先把支線劇情給完結，主線劇情的部分則像小說看到一半突然被闔上般地突兀

但，這個小小的突兀感
就是因為整個《side:above》講述、演繹故事之精彩距甚，叫讀者是深陷其中！
之前 DEMO 版其演出創意就相當讓讀者印象深刻，到了正式版是更上層樓的進化
OP 的進場、正反派角色之間的過招、人物目前所處環境的提示
（比如說在船上時，立繪會跟著搖曳。或是新角色進場時，可看出彼此在舞台上的不同位置）
在配合上時而磅礡、時而飄渺，好聽到讓人想敲碗求 Soundtrack CD 的背景音樂...
整體呈現給讀者的演出，實在是令人驚豔連連，佩服不已！

整體劇情雖然是新都市的新篇章，卻難得地在部分上延續上一部的主劇情
進一步刻劃 Rune 對過去的罪惡感以及欲贖罪卻又不知該如何開始的徬徨心情
《side:above》又提示了些許更值得玩味的設定
在故事最開頭當中發生了「重開機」的畫面，該畫面有一段訊息是「載入世界編號」
而該世界編號在附錄的遊戲用語字典當中，提到搜尋該編號後可得到各種語言的「你好嗎？」
這句「你好嗎？」的問候詞不但呼應了上一章 Rune 的「Hello, world」也呼應了《side:above》最後的劇情...
整個背景設定之伏筆耐人尋味又有趣至極！

雖然本作語言只有英文和日文
若你對其中任何一個語言之閱讀上沒有問題的話，極為大力推薦《Fault -milestone one & two》給你！

-----
Updates:
根據官方部落格的消息，下集預計是16年的冬天才會發表。T^T...
而這中間會先在16年春天的時候推出外傳《Silence the Pedant》來補充理特娜求學時的故事。

17964823.review:
Fault Milestone two side:above is an excellent visual novel sequel. It improves upon everything that fault milestone one did well while, at the same time, greatly improving the parts that weren't so good. It starts off immediately where fault milestone one left off, with the girls confronting melano. Things quickly escalate, an awesome battle ensues, and the fourth wall gets broken in one of the most epic meta scenes that have ever been seen.

The main theme of this novel is oppression and the effects that it can have on a person who has been oppressed for a long time. They show the effects of oppression by displaying them on both a personal and an international level. Two new characters, Sol and Mils, have been horribly oppressed by some of their fellow countrymen as well as people from a neighboring country. At first, I did not like these two characters but, as I watched them grow and develop, I became attached to them. Sol was my least favorite character for a good portion of the story, but he did a lot of growing up towards the end that really got me to like him.

Overall, I have to say that this is an excellent visual novel. If you've read the first fault milestone and enjoyed it, then pick this one up because you will definitely enjoy it just as much as, if not more so than, the first one. If you haven't read the first one, pick it up, read it, and if you like it, pick this one up as well. I heavily enjoyed this visual novel and I look forward to the release of fault milestone two side:below.

17964706.review:
自玩过1代以来就一直对后续剧情发展期待满满的fault milestone系列的第二作终于出了,[strike]虽然只是2代上篇[/strike]，吓得我趁着打折赶紧买了一份。以下自带隐藏微透，阅览注意。
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  画面演出方面，这代演出效果比起1代真的有很大提升，某些剧情场面的演出形式做的真的很棒。尤其是刚开始那点，[spoiler]有点FEZ开头的味道[/spoiler]，[strike]如果不是单纯的只为了演出效果而做成这种形式的话[/strike]，我只能说剧情上这坑挖的可真不小，强烈期待后续发展。总的来说这作超棒的演出效果完全掩盖了某些cg的小瑕疵。
  剧情方面。本作作为2代的上篇非常合格的把前作主线留下来的坑约挖约大。和前作一样，本作也讲述了主人公一行[spoiler]归国[/spoiler]途中[spoiler]和一对兄妹相遇而由此展开[/spoiler]的一段[strike]温馨的[/strike]小故事。而且剧情长度方面，这作真的也只有前作那么[strike]短[/strike]。区别是这作连一个选项都没有，纯粹的一电子音画小说，[spoiler]虽说前作那选项根本没用。[/spoiler]我看的比较慢，一遍通下来花了近8个小时。[spoiler]妈蛋这作为毛怎么这么短！快把下篇给老子吐出来啊！[/spoiler]
  音乐方面，一句话简评就是，哎哟终于有曲子想进音乐鉴赏模式反复听的了。但是妈蛋的鉴赏模式的单曲循环在哪?![strike]教练我要原声集！[/strike]
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  总得来说作为一款电子音画小说，本作通过超棒的画面演出，动听的游戏配乐，向我们讲述了一个发生在与我们现实世界似曾相识的异世界[spoiler]的略带伤感而又发人深省[/spoiler]的小故事[spoiler]然而个人总感觉其中夹带了些许私货2333[/spoiler]。虽然还有这样那样的瑕疵，不过至少就我个人来说，这8个小时的异世界之旅，已经值回这个票价。
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  购买推荐的话，由于系列目前依然没有中文[strike]民间汉化[/strike]，而且含有大量原创专有名词及概念，[spoiler] 虽然对照现实世界的话还是蛮好理解的[/spoiler]，语言上算是一大障碍。原价10刀[strike] 25off[/strike]的价格也确实不怎么便宜。尤其对于新入坑的玩家来说，要看懂剧情还必须玩过前一代。变相加了10刀。如果是不着急体验剧情[strike]合卡[/strike]的话可以考虑等等更大的折扣。[spoiler] 什么你从一代玩过来的？那还不赶紧买买买？[/spoiler]
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
另：冲着背景来的土豪们的话大可放心出手！这作背景真的挺给力的。[strike]1代那都是些什么鬼东西[/strike]

17964503.review:
續作標題多了side above，表示2代被拆成上下集來賣。
原因是作者覺得太長了，會超過他們「只賣15鎂」的份量，所以把它切成兩半
但這樣做造成了一個稍微嚴重的缺點。

先說優點，本作加入了一個「Camera」系統，簡單說是一個會動的第一人稱視角鏡頭。
一般視覺小說畫面構成是一張背景然後人物立繪，視角固定在畫面中央，會動的頂多是
立繪，要再有更多更大的動作就只能用CG表現。

但本作的視角會動來動去，比如說某A生氣地講了一句台詞，鏡頭會往A人物立繪的頭部拉近，然後某B也生氣地回了一句，這時鏡頭就會轉向往B拉近，這樣某種程度上改善了因為沒有語音所造成的「不知道誰在講哪句台詞」的問題。戰鬥場景上的應用就更有趣了，劇情裡某段描述了某名人物在樹與樹之間高速移動，這時遊戲用了幾張模糊的CG配合往上下左右快速移動的鏡頭，充分表現出了該人物的速度感。甚至在靜止CG上也能應用，比如一張CG裡有兩人站前方一人站後方，鏡頭會從後面那人開始往前拉直到三人都入鏡為止，真的不愧對本作介紹裡所說的「Cinematic」Visual Novel

劇情品質沒有比前作遜色，同時情節還比前作更加緊湊，但這就要講到缺點了。
我的遊戲時數是6小時，但整體應該是9小時左右，少3小時是因為我把前面一段跳掉了，
因為那些部分在試玩版就有了！玩過試玩版的人再玩這款可能會覺得份量不是很夠。
再來本作的結尾來得很突然，本作劇情有兩條線在跑，一條支線一條主線，支線一跑完
就跑出製作人員名單了，主線的謎懸在一個幾乎沒碰的進度....
作者在切半的時候應該稍微往後一點再切比較好。

下個違反常理的結論：[b]不要去玩試玩版![/b]會破壞遊戲體驗!

17960400.review:
A solid entry in the Fault series.

It expands upon the world of which we were only given a 'small town' glimpse of in the first game. The world suddenly seems like a much larger place as Ritona and the gang set out on their journey back to their homeland. We are given a chance to see our characters grow even further here, and the actual way they are written has been improved as well (although this can probably be attributed to there being a new translator for this one, if I am to believe what I've been hearing). The plot progresses quite nicely, and leaves you wanting the next part of the story to come right away, which arguably, might be the weakest point in the game. The knowledge that you will have to wait for the next portion of the story is truly the hardest part about this franchise. 

The aesthetic has improved quite a bit as well, as the new camera system does bring a lot to the table in terms of cinematic feeling. The audio is well suited for every situation, and we do see the return of the some of the tracks from Milestone One, which is definitely a plus as the soundtrack overall is rather well rounded. Last touch on aesthetic, but the actual art is also spot on, just as it was in the first game.

To conclude this short pseudo-review, if you enjoyed the first game, you will enjoy the second one. However, I highly recommend playing the first one before touching this as Milestone Two does contain major spoilers for Milestone One. You have been warned.

17959784.review:
[i][b][u]fault milestone two side:above[/u][/b][/i] is the sequel to fault milestone one. They are both fantasy/sci-fi kinetic visual novels made by Project Written.

[i]milestone two side:above[/i] is definitely a step above [i]fault milestone one[/i] in more ways than one, but also seems to fall flat in some areas.

[b]WARNING: Spoilers may be present[/b]


[b]Visuals[/b]
Is it as most, if not all visual novels, not a demanding game.
So when I booted up the game for the first time, I noticed there were close to no display settings. Something that should be absolutely vital for this type of game.
There were no resolution options, which was the worst offender in my book. True, there weren't such an option in milestone one either, but that doesn't mean it shouldn't be there. [spoiler]Please fix this for [i]milestone two side:below[/i], Project Written[/spoiler]
Anyways, as I played the game, I was continuously in awe of the art. It was bright and vibrant when it needed to be, and also dark and menacing when it didn't. All of this mixed in with Project Written's new 3D camera technology makes the world of fault seem much more alive than ever.

[b]Audio[/b]
99% of the music for [i]side:above[/i] was made by Project Written's in-house composer, who managed to make all the music fit the situations in which it was applied. Only once did I feel the music go on for too long, and that wasn't as much a melody as it was ambience.
Now, where the audio truly shines, is when it combines fitting music and sound effects.
There are moments where something really intense happens, and not only does the music increase in intensity, but the applied sound effects are equally tense.
It is overall a great improvement over milestone one.

[b]Story[/b]
The game starts off with introducing new players to the story by providing a short "previously on fault" clip that vaguely explains what happened in milestone one. This is all fine and dandy. Can't blame Project Written for wanting to still earn money on their previous installment.
Anyways, this is where the game falters a bit. It starts out strong with a "kill-or-be-killed situation" between what I assume is the main antagonist and our party of homesick travellers. Unfortunately, this is as good as it gets throughout the whole game. An incredibly well placed [spoiler]intentional game crash[/spoiler] really nails the point of helplessness our protagonists are experiencing at that moment. Don't get me wrong, the story is great. It's just unfortunate that these kinds of "tricks" aren't used again throughout the rest of the game.
The pace is very calm for most of the game, and only picks up the pace near the end.

I must warn fans: The demo is way too long compared to the full release, so if you played that first, then it might seem too short. I personally felt like it was too short after having played through the demo before-hand.


[b]Conclusion[/b]
The game looks great, sounds great and manages to pull you in from the get-go.
With the great synergy of the fantastic visuals, amazing audio and a great story, the game managed to make me experience a wide range of emotions, but never did much with it. There were times when I was sad, but never enough to shed tears. The story isn't bad, it just feels like there could have been so much more.

It is without a doubt one of the best visual novels out there. You won't regret it if you're into fantasy/sci-fi.
And for fans of the previous installment, it'll be a treat for you either way. Just don't be shocked if you find it a bit short after having played the demo (It is ridiculously long after all).


Even with it's faults, I'm still gonna recommend it to fans of the series.
I can't say the same for new players though. Play [i]milestone one[/i] before you play this.

In the end, I for one, am still looking forward to both [i]Silence the Pedant[/i] and [i]side:below[/i].

17953844.review:
Woohoo! More cute anime girls involved in crazy violence!

Fault 2 is a direct sequel to Fault 1, so you shouldn't even touch this game until you have played the first one. While there is a recap video... no. Just play the first one entirely before getting into this. It's worth it.

So is this, actually. Whereas Fault 1 introduced you to Selphine and Ritona before becoming the Rune show, Fault 2's storyline has other characters playing notable roles while still being chiefly about the thee main characters. Selphine in particular has alot to do in this part of the story, and you get to see a side of her that is the polar opposite of the huggly princess we met in Fault 1. Different to such a degree that it might frighten the player just as much as the other characters to see how much she changes. Naturally all of this is explained in the story itself, but I am not going to dig into that here because spoilers.

The story itself is still short, but if anything the quality has only increased this time. This is helped by the quality soundtrack, a far larger number of pretty CG images, and a few moments of good animation you don't usually see in VN's. Still no voice acting sadly, but that's just something you have to live with. Also, just as in the first game, Fault 2 makes some commentary on things in our world that should change. Specifically, this game digs into class divides, racism, organized crime, and even takes time to give us an internet metaphor to say that internet trolls are boring people who need to find better hobbies. XD

The game isn't perfect though. The ending is even more abrupt this time and leaves several plots dangling until the next chapter picks them up again. You go back to Rughzenhaide to meet some new characters and then... poof! Not that I minded too much because I was way more interested in what psycho Selphine was doing, but still I wonder where exactly that subplot was going. The major stuff with Ritona is left unresolved, which is kind of one of the major plot elements of the game's second half. When the game suddenly ended without this being resolved, I felt a bit cheated. Lastly, we still don't know what the hell is driving Melano, Sian, Koko, and Mharie towards all the violence we saw them perform in the opening of the first game. They want to kill Selphine? Ok we got that... but why? I know this is pretty much the core of the plot, but some progress here would have been nice. Overall I felt like this game ended too suddenly and is worse off because of it.

This is a really good VN and a worthy sequel that just... ended way too suddenly. Even moreso than Fault 1 did. I was thoroughly enjoying this until the credits started rolling. Considering it was nearly a year since the first game came out, I'd expect a similar wait for Fault 3 is to be expected. Taking that into consideration, ALICE IN DISSONANCE really dropped the ball by having my last impression of this game not be how awesome it was for it's duration, but that it had a shit ending.

I really hate when a game I really like has such a glaring flaw that I almost want to give it a negative review. But... I still enjoyed the game and am looking forward to seeing what happens next. A game I would throw under the bus would leave me apathetic rather than intrigued, so... this gets a "yes" from me despite the fact that I am giving ALICE IN DISSONANCE the kind of scary death glares that Selphine was giving throughout this game. Please don't ever do that again, or I just might be forced to rage at Fault 3 when that eventually comes out.

Beware! For I have a scary side too! O_O

EDIT: Apparently this is just the first half of Fault 2, with the second half coming later. I still think the ending was abrupt and that splitting the game was probably a bad idea... but I may have to edit this review once the second half shows up... whenever that may be.

17950844.review:
Wonderfully done. With a better translator and a clearly more experienced production staff, Alice in Dissonance is a now an indie visual novel company to look out for. The fairly interesting premise and world being developed in milestone one has started to blossom into a truly engaging and exciting story. 

I think the biggest strength of this installment is that it provides a dramatic, fast-paced episodic short story while melding it into a larger narrative. There are plenty of exciting moments, and fans who thought milestone one didn't have enough action will be pleasantly surprised. Due to events in-story, most of the focus is on Selphine and Rune, who get their chance to drive the action -- and they definitely succeed. Awesome moments abound.

Like milestone one, milestone 2a isn't afraid to pull at your heartstrings or shine a spotlight on some of the ugly things humans are capable of. There are no miracles in this world, and our protagonists can only do what they can while pressing forwards. Plus, it's clear that events elsewhere in the world proceed apace, and that what we see is merely a tantalizing glimpse of a larger backstory. I can't wait for further installments.

On a more technical note, the art quality, sound engineering, and use of game/camera mechanics have all improved significantly. There are still parts of the art that look amateurish, and the lack of voice acting is a shame, but that's to be expected in an indie game. There's also some clever breaking of the fourth wall, and the game extensively uses camera movement and selective focus on parts of CGs to create a sense of motion. This is a kinetic novel, and there are no choices.

The fault series as a whole also departs quite a bit from more conventional visual novel styles. There are very few slice-of-life or comedy scenes, and the few included give you barely enough time to catch your breath between high-tension moments. Rune, Selphine, and Ritona act with a clear sense of urgency, and the story itself accommodates that feeling. If you're used to something like Fate/Stay Night or Key works, you'll find that the narrative rolls by at a breathtaking pace.This is a short VN, and major events happen in quick succession. 

Really, though, my only meaningful complaint is that it's just too short. It's obvious that the particular storyline in milestone 2a is just a sideshow to the far more important events that will (presumably) happen in milestone 2b. 

I can't wait.

17945668.review:
I have read the 日本語(Japanese) version and this is a review of Fault Milestone Two:Above, a Fantasy;Science fiction Visual Novel, a direct continuation of Fault Milestone One.
Developed by ALICE IN DISSONANCE and translated by Sekai Project.

The Visual Novel starts off with a recap movie of Fault Milestone One as a refresher and continues off from Fault Milestone One left off where Selphine change her personality, to a more ruthless personality that is a consequence of the combination of her lineage, a defense mechanism that comes with "Path-Down"(Empress Syndrome).

[h1]The Story[/h1]
It picks off from the cliffhanger, Fault Milestone One left while travelling to another land and getting their tracks stopped by Melano a omnipotent as she casually negates Ritona's magic with no effort, and with an equal amount of effort, nukes the entire continent with one spell, before bringing everyone back to life and rewinding time to just before she cast thatspell, and then implanting the memories of both thespell and three years of the aftermath into their heads.

Then the game breaks the "fourth wall" by forcing the game to close and reopens after Melano cast her spell to destroy the Outer-Pole completely and then you get to click the "Undo" button after the game reopens looking at Melano staring right at the camera, showing that everyone have died and proving how powerful she is.
Then Melano states that "there won't be a 'undo' next time". I personally find this feature of theirs is really unique in a sense that it sends a solid message of one strenghts.
[spoiler]The Fourth Wall Will Not Protect You. ;)[/spoiler]

[h1]Audio and Visual elements[/h1]
[b]Visual elements[/b] - CGs are really good with extremely polished backgrounds and the animated scenes (Cinematic Novel) are very fluid really of high quality of work being put in there, breaking free from the static nature of many visual novels out there, and adding depth and motion to a scene to create a more dynamic emotional response. It honestly felt like watching a anime with all the camera movement and selective focus on parts to create motion.

[b]Character design[/b] - Their clothing are coloured with colours of gems for example (white and purple) and some supporting chracter have royalty colour on them which suits the setting in the Visual Novel.

[b]Audio elements[/b] - There is no voice acting, but the music are on a complete different level it perfectly sets the mood and it belongs in the situation of the environment which it was a joy to listen to in fact i found myself just pausing occasionally just to listen to the music which is something i rarely do, while the sound effect perfectly depict all the action that is going on in the background.

[h1]To sum up[/h1]
If you are looking for a high qulity Visual Novel with indepth discussion of culture with fluid writing that is never dull while talking about real world problems like discrimination of the rich and the poor.

[b]Do not give this Visual Novel a miss.[/b]

A note: The game grew outside what the developers originally intended, and it was announced that fault milestone two will be split into two parts, Fault Milestone Two side:above and Fault Milestone Two side: below.

Please note too that this novel is a direct sequel to fault milestone one and contains massive spoilers of the first story. Play through of the first title is highly advised..

17945605.review:
Overall I found ms2:a to be a very strong and quite intriguing VN.  Relative to ms1, which you absolutely should read first if you haven't, I think it's a much more tightly constructed piece of work. Everything has it's place so to speak and it's all arranged just so in a way that all comes together brilliantly. The art is very solid and I'd suggest it's a moderate step up from ms1 overall. In particular it's event CGs are very plentiful at 52 compared to the 24 found in ms1, this is despite it being only slightly longer. The art and atmosphere are also enhanced by the periodic use of camera work which typically looks quite nice, although a few graphics lack the resolution to cope with it well if your screen is over 1200p. The music is more or less on par with the previous title, although a little different as they picked up a dedicated composer. I found the writing to be a really meaningful step up from the original. This is due in part to a new translator being used who does a much better job than their predecessor. I would also mention the improved translation in turn leads to better world cohesion which is nice to see. On an aside it's worth rereading the encyclopedia, which has many of  the same entries as ms1, as the old translation was outright wrong in some cases.

In terms of possible negatives I will say with regards to the direction they go in terms of character screen time that it may irritate some people, however I can't go into that without spoilers. Personally I found it interesting although I do suspect I'll enjoy ms2:b, which I eagerly await, more than I did ms2:a.

To anybody worried about the naming scheme with regards to above/bellow, you shouldn't be. It's episodic in much the same way as ms1 and you still come away with a satisfying self contained story.

Overall I think anybody who even remotely enjoyed ms1 should be very happy with this purchase. To people who haven't read ms1 I'd suggest you go check it out. It's a little rougher around the edges but still an exceptional read.

Note this review will tag as pre-release because patreons started getting keys a few hours before launch, I also paid for a phisical JP copy and would have a key from that anyway so I don't consider it a conflict but I though I'd disclose anyway.

39012837.review:
如果说Fault第一部给我的印象是感动，这一部简直可以说是震撼。

前期全程在——
索尔太可疑了吧？
泽威茨家兄妹糖甜甜甜！
索尔果然很可疑！
露恩小姐姐帅爆了疯狂打call！
索尔...算了米尔也很可爱啦w
今天的莉冈陛下也依旧帅气打call打call！
——的谜之兴奋中度过。
[strike]掉线的莉特娜：？？？[/strike]

偷得浮生半日闲，暂且抛开莉特娜的危机[strike]（莉特娜：？？？）[/strike]，居于偏远的山林，准备食物、和米尔聊天、期待着萨姬欧拉发芽，短暂的悠闲时光让人几乎要忘掉身后的重重危机。
直到火雨落下，田地尽毁，萨姬欧拉幼苗化为灰烬，莉冈陛下使用了灵潜——揭露了被掩盖的丑恶真相。

——此间再无道义，亦无教诲，仅存压迫与谎言。
——他们想要好好活下去，想要守护重要的事物。然而留给他们的却只有残酷、悲怆和无意义的绝望。
——这就是...世界。

我几乎以为这就是结局了。
唯存绝望。
无可挽回。
一直以来的努力到底算什么呢。
做出的改变究竟有什么意义呢。
不...说到底，为什么要知道真相呢。

[spoiler]——未来视。[/spoiler]

意识到这一点的时候，我甚至没有缓过神来。
她做出了相反的选择，即使意味着这一切必须由她自己来承担。
这一刻做出决定的，不是赛尔菲妮，甚至可能不是女王莉冈。大概是融合了灵继传承和自身意志、抱定觉悟蜕变成长的...赛尔尔。
这是王族的气魄，是身为领袖的魅力、责任与代价。

——赛尔菲妮殿下总有一天也将会不得不理解这一点。
莉特娜曾在心底这样叹息过。

我一开始并没有想到见证赛尔菲妮的成长会是如此让人心疼的一件事。当她在露恩怀中痛哭时，我心中涌起的是一种无力感。
这不是甜美的童话故事。
这是残酷的现实。
所幸赛尔菲妮终究不会是历经炎狱的莉冈陛下。莉特娜、露恩，未来或许还会有更多伙伴，为这份羁绊所系，卢森海德的九代目，一定会谱写不一样的故事。

——集合起来，携手反抗吧。
——无论如何，我们...与你们兄妹同在。
——请不要把一切都担在自己肩头。

有多少感动，便有多少绝望。
然而，这只是个谎言。
在“绝望”的庇佑下挣扎着破土的，
不仅仅是萨姬欧拉的幼苗，
更是名为希望的星火。

[h1]使未石沉大海，必有传檄之波涛。[/h1]

[h1]VILSERIOL[/h1]

38976638.review:
Playtime (before going back for achievements): 4.6 Hours

[b] This is a kinetic novel. There are no choices to be made. Do not buy if you aren't okay with this. [/b]

That being said, on Fault: Milestone One, I made a claim that you should only buy the game on sale--while I still stand with that opinion on the first one, [i] I would whole-heartedly pay full price for this game. [/i]

Considering the gameplay time is roughly the same and its a continuing of the previous game, the question as to why I would pay $15USD is kind of important so let me try to explain this through my [i] speechlessness [/i].

[i] I have never once played or watched a game that was so poignantly [b] human [/b] before this game. [/i]

The world of science and magic is still fascinating, and although there were times I felt were awkward science lessons shoved in for the sake of plot, the story about the characters and the overall philosophical questions the games addresses and boils down to is not only beautiful, but uniquely handled and complicated.

The problems faced in this game were so vastly different than what was handled in the last game, yet it still boiled down to what it meant to be human--in a slightly different sense. Less of "what makes a human different than a non-human" and more "what does it [i] mean [/i] to be human." What does it mean to be in society and to have that society influence you and for you to influence it. Is it inequality if people don't know they're being discriminated against? Is it the place of outsiders to even go into developing places to encourage change?

Fundamental questions that are even so recently being thought about and discussed.
It's truly unique and handled amazingly well.
The characters are dynamic, 3-dimensional, well-rounded, and [i] engaging [/i] and that's all I could ever ask for from a kinetic novel.

39450472.review:
[h1]This will be a review covering both the first and the second games, as seems appropriate, but my review stands the same for both.[/h1]

The Fault Series is an incredible work of fantasy, with its characters vivid and breathing while exploring unfamiliar lands while facing difficult questions about our humanity.  Ritona, Selphine, and Rune are some of the best character's I have seen in a long while. 

I am going to be completely honest here, the Fault-Milestone One genuinely had me crying at the end of it, because the writers at ALICE IN DISSONANCE have a remarkable grasp on how to tell a story, and how to pace it so that it hits your emotions every time. The start of Fault-Milestone Two was lighter than the start of one, so it had me doubting whether or not it would be able to move me to the extent the first one did. It didn't, but it came close, which is impressive as this is only the first half of "Milestone 2" (which doesn't decrease it's length or quality by any means)

The Art in this is absolutely beautiful (although they do like to zoom in a bit to far sometimes on the faces), as you can see in the promotional screenshots above. The thing is, every scene looks like those, or even better. The art also aids in setting the tones of scenes with almost pinpoint accuracy.

The Cons of the Series;

Linear Storyline, sorry this is just a straight ride from beginning to end, with only one choice in the first one, and I think none in the second. I reccomend sitting back and letting the story flow.

It's Anime. If you have come to here from my friends list, you probably don't like anime. Cool, this is certainly not for you.

The price; It is 30$ for the two games, however they do go on sale during the major events. I feel like they are only worth the full price if you already know you enjoy visual novels and want another full story.

Anyway, the visual novel is worth trying!
